message.content:
cs.GT, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.EC, cs.LG. 

This paper deals with revenue maximization, which is a central topic in algorithmic game theory (cs.GT) and computational economics (cs.EC). The problem of selling multiple items to a single buyer involves designing mechanisms that allocate the items and determine the prices, which requires efficient data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). The authors also propose a simple mechanism that achieves good approximation guarantees, which involves modeling the buyer's valuations as independent and identically distributed random variables, a common assumption in machine learning and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper presents a theoretical analysis of the proposed mechanism, which involves proving bounds on the approximation ratio, a topic that is relevant to theoretical computer science and machine learning (cs.LG).
